Best Overall

ma:nyo Pure Cleansing Oil Deep Clean

Pros

  • Suitable for sensitive skin

Cons

  • Some may dislike scent

I’ve tried and liked many oil cleansers, but I truly have a love affair with this one. Even if I test a different one and think it’s doing the job well, when I come back to this one, I’m astonished by how quickly and easily it takes my makeup off. It gets rid of blackheads and sebaceous filaments that other oil cleansers simply cannot dislodge, and because it feels more like a dry oil, my skin never feels greasy after using it. I have sensitive skin, and it’s never irritated my skin or caused a reaction. The original version is great, too, but this one will forever be my favorite.

Key ingredients: Argan oil, jojoba seed oil, olive oil, camellia oil, evening primrose oil

Size: 6.7 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I really liked the consistency of this product. I typically don’t like thin oils because it feels like it’s less effective, but the Ma:nyo oil…spreads so easily. It washes off cleanly without stripping natural oils. I use a gel cleanser after this to remove the rest of the oil. It smells like rosemary and lavender. I would recommend this oil after using it.”

Best for Acne-Prone Skin

Beauty of Joseon Ginseng Cleansing Oil

Pros

  • Cost-effective
  • Suitable for sensitive skin

Cons

  • Some reviewers found it to be a bit watery

Beauty of Joseon’s sunscreen may be getting all the attention on TikTok, but this oil cleanser is just as effective and hardworking. One of the star ingredients, ginseng oil, fights environmental stressors, as the formula’s soybean oil cleanses and moisturizes.

Key ingredients: Soybean oil, ginseng seed oil

Size: 7.1 fl. oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This left my skin better than it found it. It truly gets into every crevice and pore and detoxes my face—I can feel the oil and dirt being pulled every time I massage it in. I usually wash it off with a gentle cleanser after, and my skin is left incredibly soft and plump. It also didn’t break me out. I have sensitive skin, but this is not irritating at all. The cherry on top is how affordable it is.”

Best for Sensitive Skin

Peach & Lily Ginger Melt Oil Cleanser

Pros

  • Suitable for all skin types
  • Balances skin

Cons

  • Some customers noted that it may not be as effective on certain mascaras

Peach & Lily developed this cleanser for six years before landing on this perfected formula. The product “dissolves stubborn makeup and SPF with ease without causing foggy eyes, breakouts, irritation, or drying out the skin. And the best part is the feeling it provides once it's rinsed off—there’s no residue, and skin is left supple, clear, and deeply cleansed,” Yoon shares.

Key ingredients: Ginger root extract, grapeseed oil, sunflower seed oil

Size: 5.07 fl. oz.

Peach & Lily rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Peach & Lily reviewer says: “I love the ingredients in this, and I love that it has never broken me out, as a sensitive skin girlie. It’s luxurious, emulsifies beautifully, and doesn’t feel heavy. Worth every penny.”

Best Unscented

Round Lab 1025 Dokdo Cleansing Oil

Pros

  • Suitable for sensitive skin
  • Effective on waterproof makeup

Cons

  • May feel a little heavier than other formulas

If you’re tired of rubbing your eyes to get every last bit of mascara off, this cleansing oil melts away eye makeup in seconds without any extra friction. You also won’t find that it stings the eyes or sensitizes the skin, thanks to the fragrance- and colorant-free formula.

Key ingredients: Grape seed oil, olive oil, seaberry oil

Size: 6.76 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “It’s a beautiful product in my opinion. I feel like it’s the best oil cleansing product with the way it feels and smells. It’s great for a light cleansing and keeps the skin moisturized afterwards. Good for prepping before a more exfoliating cleanser or heavy duty cleanser.”

Best Balm

Then I Met You Living Cleansing Balm

Pros

  • Pleasant scent
  • Avoids stripping skin

Cons

  • Some may dislike jar packaging

Reviewers rave about this balm’s elegant texture and cleansing powers. Within seconds, it dissolves everything sitting on top of your skin and infuses hydration as you massage it, thanks to ingredients like persimmon extract and vitamin E.

Key ingredients: Grape seed oil, olive oil, seaberry oil

Size: 3.17 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “It removes difficult makeup and sunscreen in 60 seconds (that is how long I like to massage my cleansers in), and it feels so silky on the skin. It has a nice slip to it, so I never feel that I am tugging at my face. It melts into my hands as soon as I rub them together. My biggest pet peeve with cleansing balms is that they never fully melt into my hands, and I am left with big cleanser chunks between my fingers. That is not the case with this balm. It is perfect. It does not leave a residue either, if that is something you look for. Personally, I never mind either way, because I’m going to follow with a regular cleanser right after. But this rinses off clean and leaves my face feeling soft. There is a very pleasant scent to this balm as well. I don’t find it too strong, and it doesn’t irritate my skin, either.”

Best Anti-Aging

Be the Skin Daily Complete Cleansing Oil

Pros

  • Effective at reducing blackheads

Cons

  • Some may dislike scent

According to Yoon, this “is a classic Korean cleansing oil that has had a cult following for well over a decade. ”It is especially loved by those with sensitive skin, as it removes everything effortlessly while olive oil and glycerin hydrate and ginger root delivers antioxidative benefits,” she says. The formula does feel a bit warm as you apply it, but it’s totally normal and feels quite pleasant.

Key ingredients: Olive oil, glycerin, lilac extract, ginger root extract

Size: 6.7 fl. oz.

Peach & Lily rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Peach & Lily reviewer says: “My skin feels very nourished after using this cleansing oil. It is very effective at removing the built-up excess residue that is trapped in your pores! The texture is silky, and a little drop goes a long way, so be careful, ladies!”

Meet the Experts

Why is it important to cleanse your face at the end of the day?

Sometimes, it’s all too tempting to skip your evening self-care routine and go right to bed. A gentle reminder: it’s a bad idea, even if you didn’t wear makeup that day. “Makeup, SPF, and excess sebum can all settle deeper into pores and be a trap for impurities. This build-up can cause irritation, breakouts, dullness, or decreased skincare product absorption. Cleansing skin thoroughly and gently at the end of the day helps keep skin healthy,” Yoon says.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Do you have to use another cleanser with an oil cleanser?

According to Yoon, it depends on what product you’re using. Some rinse right off without leaving behind greasy residue, so it may not be necessary to go in with another cleanser. “For other cleansing oils, you may find that without a second cleanser, it’s harder to remove the oily feeling. Everyone is different, so see what your skin loves, but for the most part, you can’t go wrong with a two-step cleanse.”
